text: Poomaram released in 2018 Indian Malayalam-language musical drama film written, co-produced and directed by Abrid Shine. The film stars Kalidas Jayaram. Principal photography began on 12 September 2016 in Ernakulam. ==Plot== The film is based on the Mahatma Gandhi University Youth Festival which takes place every year, where different colleges under the university participate for winning the champion trophy. ==Cast== *Kalidas Jayaram as Gauthaman C.A, Chairman of Maharaja's College Union *Neeta Pillai as Irene George, Chairperson of St. Teresa's College Union * Merin Philip as Friend of Irene * Architha Anish as Malavika * Joju George as Police Inspector Daya Swaroop * Professor Jayaraman Chakiat Sivaramamenon as Gauthaman’s father * Rohini Nair as Teacher * Rajesh varma (Script Writer) as Teacher * Sarvasri as Singer * Shikha Prabhakar as Singer * Ismath P.I as Singer * Ramya Krishnan as Chenda player * Pooja Suchithran as Harmonium player * Aparna as Tablist * Sreeshma as Meenakshi(Meenu) * Vivek as Vivek C.B(Kili) * RLV T K Anil Kumar as Dance Master of St.Teresa's College * Sangeetha S kumar * Mintu Maria Vincent *Kunchacko Boban as Himself (Cameo appearance) *Meera Jasmine as Herself (Cameo appearance) *Suresh Thampanoor as Suresh (Cameo Appearance) *Rasnesh Kannadikuzhi as Sunikuttan ==Production== Shooting commenced on 12 September 2016 at Maharaja's College, Ernakulam. St. Kuriakose Senior Secondary School Kaduthuruthy,Mangalam College of Engineering and St. Thomas College, Kozhencherry. ==Soundtrack== The first track "Poomaram" was released by Muzik 247 on their YouTube channel in November 2016. ==Release== The film was scheduled for release in late-December 2017, but was postponed to March 2018. The film later released on 15 March 2018. The film got mixed reviews. === Accolades === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |- ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Award ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Date of ceremony ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Category ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Song ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Nominee(s) ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | Result ! scope="col" class="unsortable" | |- ! scope="row" rowspan="1" | Mazhavil Mango Music Awards | rowspan="1" | 24 August 2018 | Best Playback Singer Female | Mruthu Mandahasam | K.S.Chithra | | style="text-align:center;" rowspan="1"| |- ! scope="row" rowspan="5" | 8th South Indian International Movie Awards | rowspan="5" | 16 August 2019 | Best Playback Singer Female | Mrudumandahaasam | K.S.Chithra | | |- |- | Best Playback Singer Female | Vaanaville | Karthik | | |- |- | Best Lyricist | Neramayi | Ajesh Dasan | | |- |- | Best Debut Actress | Poomaram | Neeta Pillai | | |- |- | Best Debut Actor | Poomaram | Kalidas Jayaram | | |- |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:2018 films Category:Indian films Category:Indian drama films Category:2010s Malayalam-language films
title: Poomaram
